results.title: Australian bushrangers: Years 4-6
results.brief_description: This program is in three sections. 1. “Convict bolters”, 2. “Wild colonial boys”, 3. “The Kelly gang” and focuses on the question “Why have we glamorised bushrangers? Uses extracts from early Australian feature films which recreate the incidents of the era 1790-1880. The bushrangers are shown as outlaws who inflicted terror and destruction on the public. This program is an edited version of “Australian bushrangers. Yrs. 7-10”

results.title: Australian Army at war
results.brief_description: A film telling the story of the Australian Army’s part in the fighting on world battle fronts, from the outbreak of war in 1939 until the surrender of Japan. It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian animals dreaming stories (A)
results.brief_description: Aborigines used stories to teach their children about the laws and myths of their land. Pauline McLeod tells five stories about unique Australian animals. Each story is laced with colourful drawings. The stories featured are: ‘The Giant goanna and the black snake’; ‘The Platypus’; ‘How the kangaroo got its pouch’; ‘Why does the kookaburra laugh?’; ‘The Bunyip’.

results.title: Australian animals
results.brief_description: Shows a wide variety of Australian animals in their natural habitat, including the spiny anteater, koala, wombat, emu, platypus, lizards, parrots and cockatoos. No narration.

results.title: Australian achievement
results.brief_description: This film showcases the production of McPherson’s “Macson” lathe featuring footage of a production line in a Holden car plant, the launch of a P.J. Adams of London ship, and sections of the power grid. Provides a detailed explanation of lathe production, including footage of the research laboratory undertaking improvement in design right up to the point of the final stage of lathes being packed for export.

results.title: Australian [colour] Diary. No. 11
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Tony Rasky, caricaturist, gives some impressions of famous sporting personalities - Lew Hoad, Herb Elliot, Peter Thompson. 2. Wellington airport, another ground link in the airways of the sky, opens with a spectacular display of flying, and exhibition of aircraft.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 038. Asian road
results.brief_description: Illustrates a Colombo Plan scheme being carried out in Thailand. Australia is helping to build a highway which will eventually cross Asia and link Teheran with Saigon. Each senior Thai engineer or technician has an Australian counterpart to assist with training and execution. Shows the conditions and difficult terrain which must be crossed.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 035. Port Moresby
results.brief_description: A day in the life of Port Moresby, the capital city of Papua New Guinea. Shows early morning arrivals of fish, fruit and vegetables at the market, the flow of traffic into the city centre, the modern office buildings, indigenous buildings and artifacts, and finally people leaving work and relaxing on the beach.
